info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:01PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Archuleta County through 330 PM MDT... At 300 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Pagosa Springs, or 15 miles northwest of Dulce, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Archuleta County, including the following locations... Gato, Juanita and Pagosa Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
